item.title: AES ECB encryption
item.description: Yealink has decided to use Advanced Encryption Standard Electronic codebook (AES-ECB) encryption. While AES encryption is considered to be same, the mode chosen by Yealink can be categorised as…sub par. ECB mode encryption is considered to be a flawed type of encryption because of the “ECB penguin” attack. I will explain this in a visual example: First of all: “Tux” is the mascotte of the operating system Linux. It is a drawing of a penguin: When performing AES-ECB encryption on the above image, it is easy to see the ECB mode is a highly suboptimal encryption method: Now, for text it may still not be possible to recover the original text (yet), but why choose an encryption mode that is known to be flawed for almost two decades.

item.title: AKD
item.description: In the fall of 2023 i was summoned by Dutch lawyer firm AKD. The name of this legal firm is relevant because this is not a small legal firm. AKD has build itself quiet a reputation. In 2022 research by Follow The Money showed that AKD did not distance itself from the Kremlin. I was highly surprised i received a summon from a lawfirm that, until recently, was working for Russian state-owned companies that were involved in the nuclear industry.

item.title: Lydis
item.description: Lydis is/was the monopolistic distributor of the brand Yealink in the BeNeLux.

item.title: Why
item.description: The question that i get the most is why i do this research. In the fall of 2023 i was summoned by Dutch lawyer firm AKD. Now there is a whole section in this research about AKD where you can read about this firm and why it is controversial. But this page is about why i am doing this research and in the summon sent to me is the following quote:
